title: Permanently Banned 1/1/2019
body:
This game has gotten the best of me. I'm quitting for the benefit of doubt... I've been playing since Season 4 and had been enjoying the game ever since but it seems that every now and then I get the one player on my team that tends to purposely troll then act ignorant about it in all chat to play victim. I did rage, I did flame, I did act toxic. I can admit that. But to be punished for raging at someone who intentionally trolled my game then have the text log based off that one game is complete bull. It's season 9 just turned 2019 and the Report System is still flawed. A billion dollar company and they tell players to mute in-game players like that will solve anything. Update after update bug after bug. I'm not looking for forgiveness, because it's passed that. Just another perma banned case. It seems hopeless to cry about the system.. It is how it is. Been like that ever since and the fact that Dunkeys good bye video is still relevant to this day sup rises me. Peace!

replies.body:
You have to play with much more calm than this. There is way too much emotion while you play. You spend most of your time badgering your team mates, when you should be congratulating them and encouraging them. 

You rank shame your allies as though Gold was really something to brag about. You score shame. You constantly harass and attack your team mates verbally. 

It's time to be much nicer in chat if you ever come back. 

{{sticker:sona-playing}}

I mean, don't act like these 2 games are the only reason you have been perma'd. To reach the point of being permed, shows that you have a history of vhat punishments. What does raging at the trolling, if they are in fact trolling, player do? Gives them the attention they wanted? Potentially make your team mates mute you so they don't have to deal with it, therefore missing any play you may call?

Updates to keep trying to evolve the game, other games do it too.

Bugs... Have you never heard the programmers creed? 99 bugs in the code, 99 bugs in the code, take one down, patch it around, 147 bugs in the code.  Codes will always generate some unintended consequence when they interact. Again, not even the only game or company that has bugs.

Dunkey... The guy who got banned for racist comments in a match and then tried to say a champ that wasn't even in that match was to blame?

You weren't permabanned for these games. You were permabanned for a _pattern_ of games like these. Riot finally realized that your behavior won't improve, so they stopped giving you chances. If the system is flawed, this ban doesn't demonstrate that flaw.

You received a permanent ban because of past behavior that was factored into your recent punishment. It does not matter if another player was trolling and acting ignorant; there are ways to deal with that, but in your case, you were just making the situation worse.
I can agree on that. I made this post out of frustration of dealing with continuous trolls and griefs in my games.

One thing to remember is that a permanent ban is never done to an account by the instant feedback/punishment system, they are only applied to an account by a support staff from riot and that person reviews your account and any past punishments and reviews chat log history.

So you certainly weren't permanently banned because of this one game, it was a long history of consistent rule breaking that lead to it.

Just thought you should know that so you don't have the wrong idea of why you were actually perm'd.

Just to correct one thing: Any punishments caused by negativity are dealt with the Instant Feedback System and not by Riot Employees. Riot will only step in to issue bans in cases of MMR/ELO Boosting and suspicious activity on the affected account.

> [{quoted}](name=HeyItzSteve,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=fobEkuEi,comment-id=00050000,timestamp=2019-01-02T09:51:35.122+0000)
>
> Just to correct one thing: Any punishments caused by negativity are dealt with the Instant Feedback System and not by Riot Employees. Riot will only step in to issue bans in cases of MMR/ELO Boosting and suspicious activity on the affected account.

how long was a few yrs ago? was it during the Tribunal era?

>
> how long was a few yrs ago? was it during the Tribunal era?

2.5
In that case you received some totally inaccurate information. The IFS was launched mid Season 5 and has always been completely automated, including permanent bans.
lmfao permabanned over nothing. I love how rito intentionally targets people who spend money on their accounts.

that's out of context in the sense. The graves was intentionally trying to piss me off and it worked. He was actively flaming it wasn't a one sided thing. Just to clarify..

Not really out of context man, it just sets an innate idea of what kind of person you are, when it comes to game interaction. I don't care if he's actively flaming you, I've been here since S3 and dealt with ridiculous toxicity and flaming but I've never been so much as muted. So I don't think you have any excuses here.
If you know how to deal with ridiculous toxicity and flaming what tips you can provide in handling it then?
